Class Conversions

java.lang.Object
Conversions
public abstract class Conversions
extends java.lang.Object
An abstract class whose methods can be used to convert a number in one base to the equivalent in another base. (Within bases 2 through 36). Because the class is abstract, no instances of it can be made, and only its static methods can be used.
Since:
4/5/2021
Author:
Austin Piper

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Conversions()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static java.lang.String decimalToBase​(int decimal_form, int new_base)
    Converts an inputted number in base 10 to the base given by new_base (bases 2 through 36 are allowed), and returns the output as a String
    static int toDecimal​(java.lang.String input_number, int base)
    Converts a given inputted number, with its base given (bases 2 through 36 are allowed), into base 10.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Conversions

      public Conversions()

  • Method Details

    • toDecimal

      public static int toDecimal​(java.lang.String input_number, int base)
      Converts a given inputted number, with its base given (bases 2 through 36 are allowed), into base 10.
      Parameters:
      input_number - The number to be converted into base 10
      base - The base of the input_number
      Returns:
      The input_number, but in base 10
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when a base less than 2 or greater than 36 is given
      NotInBaseException - when the input_number includes a character that is not part of the given base

    • decimalToBase

      public static java.lang.String decimalToBase​(int decimal_form, int new_base)
      Converts an inputted number in base 10 to the base given by new_base (bases 2 through 36 are allowed), and returns the output as a String
      Parameters:
      decimal_form - The base 10 integer to be converted
      new_base - The base which decimal_form is to be converted to
      Returns:
      decimal_form, but in the new base. Note that it is returned as a String
